thread.title: A quarter of all traffic in London was at a complete halt during Tube strike
thread.title_full: A quarter of all traffic in London was at a complete halt during Tube strike

author: JONATHAN PRYNN CONSUMER BUSINESS EDITOR
title: A quarter of all traffic in London was at a complete halt during Tube strike
text:
Queues at Liverpool Street today Jeremy Selwyn 
Commuters cross a busy Waterloo Bridge PA 
A commuter takes a photograph of a queue at Clapham Junction during the Tube strike Reuters 
Queues for the bus at Liverpool Street Jeremy Selwyn 
Bus queues at Liverpool Street today Jeremy Selwyn 
A sign warns travellers of industrial action at London's Paddington Underground Station Peter Clifton/PA 
Tube trains in sidings at Stanmore today Jeremy Selwyn 
A bus loaded with passengers as a 24-hour strike by Tube workers continues PA 
Closed gates at Victoria Underground Station Peter Clifton/PA 
Queues for buses and DLR trains at Stratford Jeremy Selwyn 
Bus queues at Liverpool Street Jeremy Selwyn 
Closed gates at London's Aldgate John Stillwell/PA 
Queues for buses and DLR trains at Stratford Jeremy Selwyn 
Bus queues in Mile End Jeremy Selwyn 26/27 Tube strike 
Tube staff are confronted by angry tube passengers who cannot get home as TfL staff close the gates at Victoria Station Nigel Howard 
A commuter reads warning signs of Industrial action of a 24 hour strike Nigel Howard 
The situation in the evening rush hour was even worse with 25 per cent of drivers in “bumper to bumper” congestion and 35 per cent in slow “heavy traffic,” according to the analysis from based traffic and navigation app Waze. 
Worst routes included Temple to Trafalgar Square, which took 40 minutes to drive one mile; Brecknock Road in Kentish Town, which slowed to an average 1mph; and the M4 near Chiswick. 
Finlay Clark, UK head of Waze, said: “Yesterday, rush-hour commuters faced severe disruption on account of the London Underground’s 24-hour strike. 
"Here at Waze, we have a wide traffic data pool thanks to over half a million London app users and can therefore offer real-time road updates and insights like never before." More about:
